abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Pollution Management
            Project for Argentina were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: A set of clear, direct, and simple
            indicators focusing on project outcome and performance can
            help improve project implementation. The statement of
            objectives and expectations should be neither too ambitious
            nor too vague. Constant changes in project management can
            adversely affect outcome, no matter how well prepared the
            project is. Proactive supervision and project restructuring
            is essential as soon as the macroeconomic situation changes
            to avoid delays in implementation.
